title: How to Turn Any iPad On: Beginner's Guide + Common Fixes

steps.title: Press and hold the top button.
steps.content: Press and hold the top button. When the iPad is held vertically, this is the button on the top-right. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Wait for the Apple logo to appear.
steps.content: Wait for the Apple logo to appear. This can take up to 8 seconds. If the Apple logo doesn't appear, charge your iPad for at least 2 hours before trying again. If it still doesn't turn on, see the troubleshooting section .

steps.title: Swipe right to unlock the iPad.
steps.content: Swipe right to unlock the iPad. If the iPad has a passcode or Face ID , you'll be asked to verify it. To turn your iPad off , press and hold either volume button and the top button at the same time. Then, drag the slider to the right.

steps.title: Charge your iPad fully.
steps.content: Charge your iPad fully. Before starting any troubleshooting steps, make sure to let your iPad charge for at least two hours.

steps.title: If your screen is frozen, force restart your iPad.
steps.content: If your screen is frozen, force restart your iPad. This process is slightly different from powering on your iPad normally. Do the following: Quickly press and release the volume button closest to the top button. Quickly press and release the volume button farthest from the top button. Press and hold the top (lock) button until the Apple logo appears. Release the top button.

steps.title: If your iPad gets stuck, use a computer to update it.
steps.content: If your iPad gets stuck, use a computer to update it. If your iPad is having problems completing the startup process, consider updating the software. [2] X Research source If you're using a Mac, open the Finder . If you're using a Windows PC, open iTunes . Locate your iPad on your computer, and then do the following: On iPads without a Home button: Quickly press and release the volume button closest to the top button. Quickly press and release the volume button farthest from the top button. Press and hold the top button. Continue holding as the iPad begins to restart. On iPads with a Home button: press and hold the Home button and top button. Wait for the recovery mode screen to appear on the iPad. On your computer, select Update from the pop-up menu. Wait for the iPad to update.

steps.title: If your iPad can't update, put it in Recovery Mode.
steps.content: If your iPad can't update, put it in Recovery Mode. If you cannot turn on your iPad, you may need to enable recovery mode. If you have not backed up your iPad onto a computer, recovery mode will revert your iPad back to its factory settings. Be careful, this will erase all of the music, apps, and files on your iPad. On iPads without a Home button: Quickly press and release the volume button closest to the top button. Quickly press and release the volume button farthest from the top button. Press and hold the top button. Continue holding as the iPad begins to restart. On iPads with a Home button: press and hold the Home button and top button. Wait for the recovery mode screen to appear on the iPad. On your computer, select Restore from the pop-up menu. Set up your iPad again.
